title.rendered: Adventurous Loveshoot with Motorcycle in Beautiful Outdoors Nijmegen

content.rendered:
It doesn’t matter where we go, as long as we’re together

Before Remo & Margriet booked this adventurous loveshoot with motorcycle in Nijmegen, they had a couple boudoir photoshoot with me. After this intimate and personal setting, they wanted something totally different, and that’s when this fun idea came to life.






“Adventurous loveshoot in Nijmegen is: The open road with an outdoorsy feeling”

As opposed to the black and white high contrast pictures of the boudoir couple shoot, we went for the open road with an outdoorsy feeling. This was the ultimate opportunity for Remo to show off his Harley Davidson motorcycle and use it as a ‘prop’ for the photoshoot. The pictures create the feel of cruising the open road and looking for adventure. It’s about enjoying the journey; it doesn’t matter where we go, as long as we’re together.






“Capture their essence”

It was very important for Remo & Margriet that the pictures were not too posed, but rather fun and spontaneous. They wanted a tough and robust look (insert motorcycle ;)) mixed with some bohemian and joyful vibes. The pictures capture the fun they’re having perfectly, and that’s exactly what I aim for whenever I am behind the camera. It’s always my goal to capture your essence as a couple.






“Always try to add something extra”

This is what I love to do; make you feel comfortable and at ease to make sure you get the best results possible. I make sure to listen very carefully so I can recreate the ideas and feelings you want to convey. On top of that I always try to add something extra, that little something you didn’t yet know you had in you ;). And always with the goal that you’ll be amazed by the results. These are the values I stand for, whether it’s a loveshoot, wedding photography, or boudoir.

Do you like this adventurous loveshoot with motorcycle in Nijmegen?
I’m always open for fun and out of the box ideas! Contact me for my availability.

In 2022 I had the honor of capturing Remo and Margriet’s summer wedding as well! Check out the results here.
